text: Sjoerd Albert Bijlsma (17 March 1920 â€“ 2 November 1984) was a Dutch graphic designer. Bijlsma studied at the Koninklijke Teken Academie in 's Hertogenbosch the Royal Academy of Fine Arts in Antwerp and at the Vrije Academie voor Beeldende Kunsten in The Hague. He became a teacher at the Vrije Academie voor Beeldende Kunsten in The Hague. Bijlsma was the designer of the corporate identity of among others and the Nebi concrete factory. He was chairman of the International Council of Design congres in Eindhoven. In 1962 he received a medal from the Advertising Society. His work has been exhibited. Bijlsma died in Kortgene on 2 November 1984, at the age of 64. ==References== Category:Dutch designers Category:Dutch artists Category:1920 births Category:1984 deaths Category:People from 's-Hertogenbosch
title: Sjoerd Bijlsma
